revised_title: Visual Identification and Analysis of Nerve Terminals in Living Isolated Skeletal Muscle
tldr: The authors successfully identified and analyzed nerve terminals in living isolated skeletal muscles using Nomarski optics and various histological techniques. They observed the unmyelinated terminal branches of motor nerve fibers in frog and mudpuppy muscles and found that nerve terminals contain accumulations of synaptic vesicles. The study provides insights into the structure and function of neuromuscular junctions and contributes to the understanding of neuromuscular transmission.
